content.description: Start matched on a large jug rail.  Make a big move up and left to the next rail.  Match and keep heading up!
content.location: If you are looking at the problem Crock Block, look left.  Old style is on the boulder that forms a roughly 90 degree angle with Crock Block.

content.description: A decent line with (what would have been if you hadn't read this description) a surprise tricky topout.    A worthy line on very solid rock. Worth doing if you are at the boulder, but aren't climbing Center Croc Bloc/Leatherback.
content.location: Heavily chalked holds on the left side of the Croc Bloc. Look for large jugs at the base, and shoot up and slightly right through a couple of tough holds.

content.description: Start on obvious jug and climb up and right to a crimp rail. Finish on slopey jugs. Enjoyable and well worth trying if you are intimidated by croc blocs stature. Although this one may be more dangerous.
content.protection: 3 pads and attentive spotters as the landing drops away over rocky terrain as you top out
content.location: If you are looking at croc bloc. Turn a 180 and scramble into a slot formed by 2 boulders where you will find the starting jug. You have most likely seen this one if you took a bathroom break between burns on croc bloc, hence the name.

content.description: Sit start on the brick back in the low roof.  Move out to the jug rail and finish on Old Style.
content.protection: A pad or two should be comfy.
content.location: The low roof on the boulder just left of the Croc Block.

content.description: Sneaky little fella that shoots up on the far left of the Croc Bloc, just avoiding the tree. Climbs reasonably well, once you can figure out how to use the holds without touching the tree. Topout is the crux, I think.
content.location: Far left side of the main Croc Bloc face, just right of the tree.

content.description: Start on obvious chalked jug on right side of Crock Block just left of the split in the boulder. Move up right and use pinches and a good edge to gain the lower mantle.
content.location: On Crock Block, on the right side.

content.description: Sit start on low white jugs and move through steep but good holds to a sloped mantle top out.

Start on the big jug in the middle of the wall at about chest height. Climb up the middle of the wall using slopers, heel hooks, and crimps to a powerful gaston move. Match it up and top out the tall face.
content.location: Middle of the wall with a big rectangular start jug with a knob on the left side.

content.description: Across from the Croc Bloc Boulder, wedged between two boulders. Start on good holds on the arete, the lowest start on the arete is a sit V10. Top out on the left side of the alligator nose feature, using crimps and core tension through the roof.
content.location: Across from the croc bloc boulder, a tight fit along the arete of the alligator shaped boulder.
